com.mongodb.rhino
Class JSON

java.lang.Object
  com.mongodb.rhino.JSON

public class JSON
extends Object

Conversion between native Rhino objects and JSON, with support for MongoDB's extended JSON format.

This class can be used directly in Rhino.

Author:
Tal Liron

Method Detail

from

public static Object from(String json)
                   throws JSONException
Recursively convert from JSON into native JavaScript values.

Creates JavaScript objects, arrays and primitives.

Parameters:
json - The JSON string
Returns:
A JavaScript object or array
Throws:
JSONException

from

public static Object from(String json,
                          boolean extendedJSON)
                   throws JSONException
Recursively convert from JSON into native JavaScript values.

Creates JavaScript objects, arrays and primitives.

Can optionally recognize MongoDB's extended JSON: {$oid:'objectid'}, {$binary:'base64',$type:'hex'}, {$ref:'collection',$id:'objectid'}, {$date:timestamp}, {$regex:'pattern',$options:'options'} and {$long:'integer'}, {$function:'source'}.

Parameters:
json - The JSON string
extendedJSON - Whether to convert extended JSON objects
Returns:
A JavaScript object or array
Throws:
JSONException

to

public static String to(Object object)
Recursively convert from native JavaScript, a few JVM types and BSON types to extended JSON.

Recognizes JavaScript objects, arrays, Date objects, RegExp objects, Function objects and primitives.

Recognizes JVM types: java.util.Map, java.util.Collection, java.util.Date, java.util.regex.Pattern and java.lang.Long.

Recognizes BSON types: ObjectId, Binary and DBRef.

Note that java.lang.Long will be converted only if necessary in order to preserve its value when converted to a JavaScript Number object.

Parameters:
object - A native JavaScript object
Returns:
The JSON string
See Also:
fromExtendedJSON(Object)

to

public static String to(Object object,
                        boolean indent)
Recursively convert from native JavaScript, a few JVM types and BSON types to extended JSON.

Recognizes JavaScript objects, arrays, Date objects, RegExp objects, Function objects and primitives.

Recognizes JVM types: java.util.Map, java.util.Collection, java.util.Date, java.util.regex.Pattern and java.lang.Long.

Recognizes BSON types: ObjectId, Binary and DBRef.

Note that java.lang.Long will be converted only if necessary in order to preserve its value when converted to a JavaScript Number object.

Parameters:
object - A native JavaScript object
indent - Whether to indent the JSON for human readability
Returns:
The JSON string
See Also:
fromExtendedJSON(Object)

to

public static String to(Object object,
                        boolean indent,
                        boolean javaScript)
Recursively convert from native JavaScript, a few JVM types and BSON types to extended JSON.

Recognizes JavaScript objects, arrays, Date objects, RegExp objects, Function objects and primitives.

Recognizes JVM types: java.util.Map, java.util.Collection, java.util.Date, java.util.regex.Pattern and java.lang.Long.

Recognizes BSON types: ObjectId, Binary and DBRef.

Note that java.lang.Long will be converted only if necessary in order to preserve its value when converted to a JavaScript Number object.

Parameters:
object - A native JavaScript object
indent - Whether to indent the JSON for human readability
javaScript - True to allow JavaScript literals (these will break JSON compatibility!)
Returns:
The JSON string
See Also:
fromExtendedJSON(Object)

fromExtendedJSON

public static Object fromExtendedJSON(Object object)
Recursively converts MongoDB's extended JSON to native JavaScript or native BSON types.

Converts {$date:timestamp} objects to JavaScript Date objects and {$regex:'pattern',$options:'options'} to JavaScript RegExp objects.

The following BSON types are supported: {$oid:'objectid'}, {$binary:'base64',$type:'hex'} and {$ref:'collection',$id:'objectid'}.

Parameters:
object - A native JavaScript object or array
Returns:
The converted object or the original
See Also:
ExtendedJSON.from(ScriptableObject, boolean)
